double lonDeg

Detailed Description

Class representing a real world WGS84 coordinate in degrees.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

WFAPI::WGS84Coordinate::WGS84Coordinate (  ) 

Default constructor. Both latitude and longitude will be set to 180.0 degrees. This will be an invalid coordinate.

WFAPI::WGS84Coordinate::WGS84Coordinate ( double  latDeg,
double  lonDeg 
)

Constructs a WGS84Coordinate in degrees. As the name implies, the degrees are defined using the World Geodetic System - revision WGS84.

Parameters:
latDeg The latitude in degrees.
lonDeg The longitude in degrees.

WFAPI::WGS84Coordinate::WGS84Coordinate ( const WGS84Coordinate &  coord  ) 

Creates a copy of the supplied coordinate.

Parameters:
coord The coord to copy.

Member Function Documentation

bool WFAPI::WGS84Coordinate::isValid (  )  const

Returns whether the coordinate is valid. If the longitude and latitude is equal to 180.0, the coordinate is invalid.

Returns:
true if the coordinate is valid.

WGS84Coordinate& WFAPI::WGS84Coordinate::operator= ( const WGS84Coordinate &  other  ) 

Assignment operator.

bool WFAPI::WGS84Coordinate::operator== ( const WGS84Coordinate &  rhs  ) 

Compare operator

Parameters:
rhs The position to compare with
Returns:
If they are equal.

WGS84 latitude in degrees.
